chargeHist.descr: Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture Methamphetamine - Presence of Child Less Than 14 Years Old
Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture Methamphetamine - Presence of Child Less Than 14 Years Old

result.execSummary:
The defendant Casey L Ladwig was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Casey L Ladwig is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Casey L Ladwig was found guilty of Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(>3-10g) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)2.
  • Casey L Ladwig was found guilty of Possess Methamphetamine Precursors, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.65.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

3:31 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Erik Johnson.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Johnson - will proceed with sentencing.  ADA concurs.  Sentencing statement by ADA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Johnson.  No statement by defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

COUNT 1

-SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 4 years.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.  To be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the term of probation.  Failure to pay may result in the suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
-Randum UA's at least twice per month.
-AODA
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

COUNT 3

-120 days county jail.  Sentence is to commence within 60 days.  Court grants huber, out-of-county service and out-of-county travel.
-Court costs.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 

Court adjourned at 3:38 p.m.
Sentencing hearing on August 21, 2018 at 03:00 pm.
Sentencing hearing on August 13, 2018 at 10:30 am.

8:48 a.m. Defendant in court with Atty Eric Johnson. Andrew Christenson appears for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by the Court - have received a plea questionaire indicating defendant will plead to Counts 1 and 3. Statement by Atty Johnson -  requests plea hearing today, and sentencing to be set out. Defendant will plea to amended count 1 as a party to a crime (939.05), and to count 3 as charged. Defendant concurs. DA concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Atty Johnson enters a plea of NO CONTEST on defendant's behalf. Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 1 and 3, amending count 1 to party to a crime. Remaining counts are dismissed. Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today. Court sets for sentencing hearing on August 13, 2018 at 10:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 8:55 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 13, 2018 at 08:45 am.
